description:
This is going to be the new to go pancakes breakfast burritos and let me just tell you about this wonderful homemade whipped cream they put on the pancakes I think I could eat this on everything !!!!! ALL THE FOOD IS JUST SO FRESH AND PETER WAS AWESOME   


Thank you to Peter and the COOK I didn't get your name but thank you!!!!!!
author: Ernesto S.

description:
I really like Big Joe's. I love the french toast and went through a long phase of addiction to it!

But one thing that really sunk my experience was that they'd constantly be getting phone / internet orders. There'd be a huge line out the front, people inside waiting for their breakfast, and for service like checks and coffee, but the whole kitchen (and front of the house as well) would be slammed cooking food for people who weren't actually in the restaurant.
People would be starving, getting cranky, and watching the kitchen work like mad but it was taking way too long to get their food. I'd see folks just walk out.
author: Monica H.

description:
Big Joe's is a typical diner serving up breakfast foods but the food was kinda bland. The prices have also gone up from last time I came here. 

It's a small and quaint diner that serves up pancakes, omelettes, sandwiches, and the like. Their chicken pesto omelette leaves much to be desired, they made an omelette then dabbed some pesto sauce on top. I wish I could say I enjoyed the food but it really tasted bland. Service and coffee are good though!

Parking is limited to street parking as per usual.
author: Derek T.

description: This a great little spot! Great menu and good friendly service. Came here with a friend and we both enjoyed it. I would definitely consider coming back another time and trying the breakfast!
author: Adrian V.

description:
I wanted to love this place because it's in our neighborhood and we love trying local, but the food was so meh that I'll stick to the other cafe that's closer to our house. 

I came here on a Saturday morning and it wasn't busy at all. We were seated right away. We ordered coffee and water and the waitress that was helping us was very sweet. 

We ordered the Eggs Benedict and Big Joe's breakfast burrito. The food came out pretty fast and hot. The eggs Benedict was forgettable and I don't really recommend. The ham slices were thin and for some reason they added a slice of tomato to it that we picked out. I'm also not sure if it's because they poach their eggs in water with vinegar but the slices of ham had a sour taste to them. 

The Big Joe's breakfast burrito was alright. It was more of a lunch dish than breakfast. Most of the filling was the seasonal veggies (which I think it was mostly zucchini and a little mushroom) and egg. I wished they used a little more turkey or bacon. The green salsa it came with was also very spicy. 

As we were paying, a party of 16 tried to find a table. That's almost the entire restaurant.  The place is very small and if you're bigger than a party of 5 or 6, I'd say pass or try calling ahead first to see if they can accommodate.
author: Junella T.

description: Food is ok, place too small, the guy very rude he pick up my bread plate before I finish with, he blame that I did not get bread bcs I order a side of fruit " side of fruit doesn't mean extra cost? Basically blame it on me and I also noticed they want customers to order, pay and leave  literally before u even finish u have the bill in front of you. Actually  the lady is nice and caring. Unfortunately I'm not coming back
author: Margarita L L.

description: Big Joe's is a cozy, neighborhood diner serving classic American fare.  I recommend the eggs Benedict!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I highly recommend Big Joe's for your palate.  The restaurant is clean, modern and cozy.  And the owner is friendly, personable and makes everyone feel welcomed.

I just had a great breakfast and the dish wasn't even on the menu -- yet.  I came in at 7:45 am and was immediately greeted, seated and offered coffee.  I looked at the menu and at first I was a little disappointed that my favorite go-to - Joe's Special (made with ground beef, eggs, spinach, mushrooms and onions) wasn't on the menu.  I asked the owner about it and he was happy to have it cooked up for me.  To my delight the chef made it perfectly!  And the owner has decided to put it on the menu.  Love it!  I'm planning to have more meals here!
author: Nelia H.

description: The food is great! I got the eggs benedict and my partner got the breakfast burrito. She liked her food and i liked my food! The place is very chill and it can get busy sometimes but thats not an excuse to not clean the tables. The tables were dirty when we got seated and the waitress didnt even bother to clean it. Price was kinda expensive for the food as well
author: Rafael A.

description: We came to Joe's after a night out. Basically we were looking for hangover food and the 3 of us ordered burgers. The food was good and hit the spot!
author: Raman S.

description: Ate here twice in three days during our visit. I had the meat lovers breakfast burrito twice with awesome home fries. My wife had an omelet once and the steak sandwich the second time. Great food and service. Nice little neighborhood cafe. Open for breakfast and lunch only. Closes at 3.
author: Tom K.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning for some breakfast. The spot is fairly small, as most places are in SF. They were pretty busy when we came by but only had to wait for 5 minutes til a table opened. 

Their menu is typical American style diner food. I ordered the eggs Benedict and it was pretty tasty. There was a little bit of a wait for our food but they were busy and they aren't a huge kitchen. The staff is super friendly and makes you feel welcomed. I definitely need to come back and try their pancakes or French toast, which looked pretty yummy!
author: Lauren P.

description:
I first found this place one day when I was taking summer classes at city. Came in right before closing and grabbed an amazing burger. 

The food is great, traditional American dishes with a local twist that puts them above average! 

My favorite is the chicken pesto omelette. Tender grilled chicken in a flavorful pesto sauce wrapped in a fluffy egg, topped with a melting Monterey Jack slice (only makes sense, being on Monterey blvd)... Perfection 

Also try to go with a friend or two so you can split a side of their signature french toast! 

The owner and staff have all been great and have positive vibes. The regulars too! The place has a real local vibe, like locals who actually grew up in SF. I feel at home whenever I'm here. 

I have returned numerous times and still look forward to coming and eating here!
author: Yosof R.

description:
I wanted to like this place because it's close to home and the service was friendly, but the food was not all that great.

I came in a group of four on a Sunday morning. The place is small. I can imagine there's only about 20 seats or so, but my friends and I opted for this place in hopes that there wouldn't be a crazy long wait. Luckily, we were seated immediately.

I ordered the breakfast burrito, which was a good size and I had to save the other half for later. The food was good, but not great. The wait was also pretty long from order to arrival. We probably waited almost half an hour, and by then we were hangry. Or at least I was.

I'd like to give this place another chance because of the great reviews and the friendly people so maybeeeee I'll be back.
author: Michelle H.

description:
First place I came to when arriving in SF to visit my girlfriend and some friends. I've never been to SF before but I told them to take me to some place local and welcoming. And here we are. 

Big Joe's provides you with that classic SF feel and vibe instantly when you walk in. Warrior posters, and pictures of classic SF stars and sports teams. You'll get a greeting from a charismatic local with a loud voice which makes you feel right at home. The modern diner style feels almost stereotypical from the shows and movies you'd see. The gentlemen that runs the place was as friendly as could be. He offered us free coffee and chatted with us about where we were from and what was good on the menu. 

My favorite go to breakfast/ brunch food are the classic eggs benedict's and hash browns. I was not disappointed. The hollandaise sauce was well done and the eggs benny. Came with avocado spread. I couldn't ask for a better local breakfast experience. 

4.5/5. There were some fruit flies that just flew around and being a pain. Definitely will come back and definitely recommend.
author: Brandon D.

description:
Being a smaller place, we waited 15-20 min for a table with a couple people after us and shortly after being seated ordered our food. We were talking for around 20-30 minutes before any mention of our food not being made and the people who were seated 10 minutes after us received their food. It was at that point we decided to leave.

I gave an extra star for receiving a free drink that stopped my blood sugar from dropping too low while we waited. Thank you for that.
author: Vince L.

description: This is my brother's favorite neighborhood spot for breakfast, and they know him here. I'm not a big breakfast person and had a delicious bacon cheeseburger. Just a little diner with good people and good food.
author: Ha D.

description: First time at this GREAT neighborhood joint! Pete's the the BEST! Came here with a couple of friends after taking a test, and was pleasantly surprised! The little Asian waitress was a HUGE sweetheart, and very attentive! The menu options were great, and the food was awesome! It's a really small place, but things flow quickly! The kitchen pumps out great food at lightning speed, and there's always something on the TV to keep you occupied! Parking can be a little challenging in this area, but this place is definitely worth the time! An absolute must go to place!
author: Dezi S.

description: Best Benedict and coffee around the neighborhood. This is my go to spot for breakfast any day of the week.
author: Alex C.

description: Long wait but pretty good customer service. The fried chicken sandwich was excellent. It was juicy and crispy at the same time. Would definitely recommend. The eggs Benedict was decent as well. I would plan a little bit of time for brunch if you come on a weekend.
author: Anthony S.

description: My boyfriend and I mozied in this Saturday morning for brunch, waited for 5 minutes and were greeted by Joe himself and his kind waitstaff. We ordered a traditional two egg breakfast + an omelette, and at the waitresses recommendation also a half order of the brioche French toast....SO glad we did! Ugh, so delicious. This spot is definitely a gem for a low key weekend brunch!
author: Julie O.

description:
I went here for the first time today with my friends. Just walking in, I was treated with a great hello. 

Food: I decided to go with the banana buttermilk pancakes because you can never go wrong with pancakes. In my opinion, the pancakes were amazing. The bananas worked well in the pancake and I loved it!

Service: 5/5-"Big P" always came around and asked how everything was going, always making sure things were going well.

I'd recommend everyone to go here! It's a great brunch place and worth the drive out.
author: Gurmun S.

description:
I was super disappointed with my experience today. It was so incredibly disorganized, and I left really wishing we chose somewhere else to spend our weekend breakfast trip. 

When we got there a few people were waiting, so we went inside to get our name on the list. One chick behind the counter told us she'd be with us in a few minutes because she needed to clean a few tables, so we said ok and stepped outside so we weren't in the way. Nobody came to put our name on the list and several tables got up and left, but they don't have a busboy so the busy servers had to clean the tables. It's too much for them and seriously took for ever!! One lady finally came outside to call people on the list, but she was so flustered that it took forever to organize who sat where, and I had to remind her my name wasn't on the list, but we were before several people on it. 

We finally got a table and they took our order quickly. Great. But then we had to wait FOREVER for our food. Everyone around us got their stuff, and they had been seated around the same time, and we sat waiting for at least 30 minutes. My husband started to get a headache because he hadn't eaten yet (we arrived around 10:45 and it was 11:35). When we finally received our food it wasn't even worth it. Super average and the eggs in my omelet were over-cooked and almost hard. It was the Spanish omelet and I wouldn't recommend it at all. The flavors did not go together and the salsa wasn't great. I also didn't care for the dressing on the salad. The only thing I really enjoyed was my latte. My husbands spinach and egg sandwich was pretty bland too.

The servers meant well, but they're asked to do too much and their service suffers because of it. Our server even said that she usually likes to take drink orders first and then return for food orders, but since we had to wait so long she wanted to take everything at once. She said that same thing to at least two more tables, and she shouldn't have to. If they had an extra set of hands all of this could potentially be avoided. And they knew we waited forever for our food, even acknowledged this when dropping it off, but did absolutely nothing about it. 

We will never be back, especially since the food wasn't that great.
author: Steph L.

description: Friendly little spot (maybe seat 20) with street parking. The Eggs Benedict were perfectly poached and not drowning in hollandaise sauce. The English muffin was toasted crisp but not burnt. The tomato added a refreshing twist. Pecan pancakes were packed with pecans and fluffy. You have an option of mixed greens or country potatoes. The mixed greens were fresh and a healthy welcomed option. Definitely would return if in the area.
author: Susan E.

description: Food was really good! Service was decent, they are a little understaffed. There were 5 of us and everyone enjoyed their food. The pancakes, omelette, tuna melt and side salad with vinaigrette tasty. The Arnold Palmer was disgusting. I would recommend this little place!
author: Brandon B.

description: Very good service by Raoul and the fried chicken sandwich with Granny Smith apples and aioli rocked! Thank u Yuri for cooking it up right!! They have great tunes from the 50's and 60's! Ok just came back here for breakfast and it was rocking too! I had the chicken pesto omelet  and it was happening!! No skimping on the chicken at all!! This time had the privilege of having Big Joe service us and man are they genuinely kind here!! Will definitely be back again!!!
author: Curtis L.

description: Really good food and service. Got the bacon egg breakfast sandwich and the spinach and egg breakfast sandwich with home style potatoes.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Based on service I would give this place 4-5 stars, but unfortunately I just feel that the food wasn't quite on par. I ordered the egg benidict with fruits on the side. The egg benidict was definitely overcooked because when I cut the egg the yolk was solid and did not spill over. For the fruit bowl the mango in the bowl wasn't rip so I was confused why it was served to us. 

On the bright side the server was extremely friendly and made sure we were taken care of.
author: Galen W.

description: This place was recommended by my son who lives in San Francisco. We were down visiting him for the weekend. While he was at work that morning he said you have to try Big Joe's. Service is super friendly. Did not have to wait long at all. Food is amazing. You you are in the area you must go here. You wont be sorry,
author: Michelle M.

description: A cross between Bobby Canavale and the cool diner, this is my new bestest perfect SF breakfast place. The chorizo special is great, the coffee great, but it's the people working it that knocked me out!
author: Kevin F.

description:
THE most delicious French toast, breakfast burritos, and friend chicken sandwich we've ever had!
Such a hidden gem with great, no bullshit service!

Amazing, highly recommend to everyone
author: P S.

description: This local breakfast diner serves the best homemade oatmeal in the world! Oatmeal was beautifully flavored and loaded with fresh pears! It was gorgeous and creamy, unlike most oatmeal you find in restaurants. Owner, Peter, is super friendly and personable. They have an extensive breakfast menu with yummy items, including breakfast sandwiches on ciabatta bread. Ample, free street parking and a couple of outside tables are an added bonus.
author: William H.

description: Amazing breakfast place anytime I'm visiting my brother and want breakfast only non disappointment place is big Joe's reminds me of a east coast style I'm accustomed too you won't be disappointed!!
author: Fernando S.

description:
First time here, love the environment.

Boss is very friendly and talkative. 

Ordered Chicken & Pesto Omelette with potatoes 

Love their potatoes 

Organic Coffee 

Both were really good.

Will be back.
author: Mack A.

description:
Always a favorite after all these years! Quality and customer service is always paramount here. The staff continues to be friendly and attentive , whether it's Pearl's positive and pleasant personality or Big's passion for people , this is the place to be! 

I just realized that there are an annoyingly amount of "p" words in this review  

Well if you're still reading this , stop by for an awesome cup of coffee , delicious pancakes , and a family like atmosphere .
author: The D.

description: A bit on the pricier side however totally worth it. The customer service is always amazing and definitely proves to be extremely family oriented. I come back every so often for the breakfast burrito and lastly if you check in you get a free coffee!
author: Joseph K.

description:
Food was delicious! There was a bit of a wait the Saturday morning I came in, but it was understandable since it seemed they were short staffed. 
Small local place with a simple menu. Eggs benedict was made to near perfection. I wish I took a picture of it but I was too hungry to really wait.
author: Rafael T.

description:
We come here again and again. Our favorites include their destination oatmeal with pear and dollop of heavy cream. Mine is their breakfast burrito. 

Great service. Very few tables
author: Dan E.

description:
To start this review on a high note, hands down probably one of the best pancakes I've had in a long time. The berry butter, was great on top of the pancakes.

As for the experience, probably not gonna go back here. Service was really challenging. The restaurant consisted of probably no more than 3 tables for groups of 4, and probably a couple more tables for groups of 2 and a counter for another 5. I noticed 3 servers and 1 child, probably the daughter of the owner. I guess my biggest gripe was getting a glass of water. I asked for a cup of water from waiter #1, and I never got it. I asked waiter #2 and still no water. I asked the child for water and then finally I got it. Then our food came, I ordered an all meat omelette with home fries. There was nothing special about it but it's ok since the pancakes definitely was worth the meal.

Then my cup of water was empty. I asked waiter #1 - no water. Waiter#2 - no water. I saw waiter #2  bussing the next table to us so I asked him again, he seemed annoyed when I asked him again. He said, yes I'll get it. And surprise... Still no water. I'm like what's so hard about remembering to fill up a cup of water? This place isn't that big for no one to go around to fill people cups.

Definitely not going back, yes just because of that.

Oh another thing. I wanted to order French toast, the waitress said that they were sold out. While eating the table next to us talked toa other waiter and they said they never got the French toast they ordered. They said that If they haven't cooked it, cancel it. The server said that they haven't made it but if they wanted they can make it to go, I was flabbergasted.. Did they lie to me on running out of French toasts? Ugh..
author: Jan R.

description:
Food: 
French toast is 5/5. When I ate it, I was sad it was only a side portion. :)  
I had a turkey omelet and it was ok. I felt the eggs needed salt and using higher quality turkey would have made the omelet better. The coffee is 5/5. 

Experience:
I went on a weekday. Although it says they open at 7 am I was surprised when I arrived around 8:30 am, and the coffee wasn't prepared. I had to ask for coffee refills for my husband and me frequently, but interestingly I never had to ask for the bill. The TV was on, and it was quite loud. I like being able to enjoy good food and have a nice conversation when eating out, so I'm not a fan of televisions in restaurants.

There was also a loose dog I was greeted by when I arrived which turned out to be the worker's dog. He said it normally stays in the back. Odd.

Suggestion to the restaurant: 

Please laminate your menus.
author: Angela V.

description: If your looking for a dank classic diner then look no further. The ingredients were high quality and the meal was delicious. I had two eggs over easy and they were cooked to perfection. The bacon was thick and delicious. The home style breakfast potatoes were toasted on the outside but retained their light fluffy potatoes inside. This place is going to be my go to diner for breakfast from here on out.
author: Charles B.

description:
I made a reservation for 9am on a Saturday earlier in the week. Turned out the reservation isn't needed for a party of 4 that early! However, it's better to do so if you don't have time to wait; just in case. 

I had the turkey & spinach omelette which I thought was really filling and delicious! The potatoes were mouthwatering! My sourdough was burnt though. I also had a free cup of coffee from checking in on Yelp which was perfect as 9am is early for me on a weekend. Prices are decent overall for dishes ranging $10-$15. However, I thought my friend's glass of orange juice for $4+ was overpriced. 

The ambiance was quite nice, though the place was a tad too small. It got loud when the place became packed around 10. Also, we weren't really checked on during the meal. Service was just decent. Parking may be a bit difficult as only street parking is available. We lucked out since we drove a smaller car. Will be back!
author: Kristi T.

description:
*This applies to online yelp orders only. 

My bf and I ordered through yelp & had quite the disappointing experience. 

FOOD:
- Spanish omelette +3/5
This omelette tasted like potatoes because that's primarily what was stuffed in the omelette. Also, I requested fruit instead of potatoes on the yelp app and also had my bf ask to confirm again that there would be fruit instead of potatoes but was given NOTHING instead: no fruit AND no potatoes. 
- French Toast +4.5/5
My bf loved this! The dish was so fluffy & fulfilling and he has high standards for French toast too. 

It's not bad for your neighborhood brunch place but it definitely doesn't compare to the ones in downtown SF.
author: Rachel Y.

description: Judging by the reviews, I guess he's had better days. Our lunch was not so good.
author: A To Z.

description:
Nearly perfect establishment! Loved the theme (proud sf giants fans roam here), menu, prices were reasonable, location was fair with hourly street parking around the corner, and the atmosphere was cozy without being noisy or stuffy. There was a misunderstanding with my order, and several times we needed to ask for something, so the service could have been more attentive, but it was overall a lovely experience. I ordered the big joe breakfast burrito and split a small order of french toast. The french toast was delightful, moist, sweet, and worth ordering again and again. My burrito was steamy with fresh ingredients, but I'd probably try something else next time. The free coffee yelp offer was a nice plus as well. 

I can see myself journeying back here, and bringing others along as well.
author: Kristy F.

description:
I love small off the beaten path cute diners for brunch because I dislike waiting 1 hour or more on a weekend for French toast which doesn't take a culinary genius to create and secondly there is a certain charm with well worn diners. Big Joe's fits this description and although nothing in particular stood out, I would stop through if I was in the area(Outer Mission).

Speaking of French Toast, I in fact ordered the Brioche French Toast, which was sweet, a bit tangy, and gooey like I like it. I was a bit irked that although they offered a free cup of coffee with your Yelp check-in, they said it only applied to one per table(we had 4 Yelpers at the table).

It's difficult for me to give a brunch place 4 stars or higher  unless it bowls me over. Although service was friendly and the food hit the spot, I wasn't overly impressed.
author: Angela L.

description: This place was small and simple, nothing fancy. I ordered the 2 organic eggs any style ($10) that came with potatoes, 3 bacon slices, and 2 sourdough slices.
author: Megan L.

description: If you want to enjoy breakfast with a friendly staff and humble Origins this is your place. Was greeted by a very nice waitress who shared the story and took very good care of us. The food was very hot and tasty, and very well put together. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a couple quality bite to eat for breakfast or lunch.
author: Lorenzo J.

description: Really fast and friendly! Food was great and the owner was personable, if you're a tourist like my boyfriend and I, he's a nice guy to chat with about travel!
author: Taylor N.

description: I thought this place was pretty good.  The waiter was very welcoming and made us out of town era feel like locals.  I think his name was Pete.  I recommend this spot!  Coffee was great food was delicious and service was spot on.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Searching around for some breakfast and I'm So glad I came across this place!!! Not only was the food great but so was the service!
author: Cassandra T.

description: THE BEST FRENCH TOAST, EVER! Super friendly service, food presentation was definitely photo ready and picture perfect! Eggs Benedict was just perfect! Big Joe's is now a destination spot whenever we are back in SF!! Thanks a bunch!!
author: Danny H.

description: Great neighborhood spot, just dripping with character, and the food is really good too. I always leave with a smile. Highly recommend the breakfast sandwich, burrito, eggs bene, and just about anything else on the menu!
author: Josh R.

description: Second time here and can't wait to go back !! Lunch and breakfast were great. BUT - THE SERVICE !! You would think you were at the Ritz. They all are so kind and you want for nothing. Don't walk to this place - RUN.
author: Gary R.

description:
I'm hardly ever in this part of San Francisco even though it's not that far from pleasant, family-friendly 'hoods like Glen Park and West Portal. The truth is there isn't that much to patronize along this quiet stretch of Monterey Blvd. except a smallish Safeway, which makes a place as bustling as Big Joe's stand out even more. It's actually a tight fit in here where tables are crowded together with just two booths where parties of four can dine comfortably. Much to the pleasure of the staff, I sat myself down at the otherwise empty counter.

Because I had no one to chat with, I kept perusing the Yelp app to see what fellow foodies recommended. A weekend-only special, the $10 Big Joe's Egg Tart was getting a lot of kudos, but I have to admit I was not in a quichey mood. Maybe kitschy but not quichey. While momentarily considering one of the breakfast ciabatta sandwiches, I went very low-key and ordered the $9.75 Turkey Spinach Omelette. It was a standard diner treatment with the egg immaculately squared off and none too fluffy with a split toasted English muffin on the side.

It was still satisfying with plenty of turkey inside and the spinach wrapped on the outside almost like Greek dolmas. The fresh mozzarella was actually placed on top instead of melted inside, perhaps to prove that it was indeed fresh cheese. The best part of the plate may have been the home potatoes, which although perfectly cubed, was searingly hot and nicely seasoned (photo: http://bit.ly/1PI8Wlq). Now those, I would have ordered to go if I had room. A solid staff kept the energy up in this compact space as did the undeniably smooth coffee (photo: http://bit.ly/1JtXDJV).

FOOD - 3 stars...omelette was a bit generic but the potatoes and coffee are aces
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...a tight fit but no one was waiting...counter seating wasn't bad
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...service was pretty attentive and the food didn't take long to arrive
TOTAL - 3 stars...solid coffee shop vibe makes this a viable daytime option
author: Ed U.

description:
Big Joe's is a great place on Monterey when you want to brunch but don't want to spend $15 for one plate (which is pretty much the norm in SF). I've been here twice and left feeling satisfied both times! The service is always exceptionally friendly and i've never had to wait for a table.The ambiance is like a diner and they have a bunch of sports memorabilia on the walls which is pretty cool to look at while you're waiting for your food.

I've tried the chicken pesto omelette, the veggie hash with eggs, buttermilk pancakes, and egg & cheese sandwich with ham. Of all the dishes i've tried, my favorite is the buttermilk pancakes. They are super fluffy and they also come with a delicious strawberry butter that has real bits of strawberry in it! Also, you can get a half stack (just 1 pancake) instead of getting two. I also really liked the egg & cheese sandwich that my boyfriend ordered once, but unfortunately it didn't have avocado like it says on the menu. :( That would've definitely made it better!

Oh, and you get a free coffee with yelp check in!!
author: Tara A.

description: Always yummy and never disappoints! The fried chicken sandwich is hella good! I've tried most things on the menu and they are all yummy! Great place if your bringing kids. The coffee is not the best, but the hot tea is bomb!
author: Rae R.

description:
Food:  
-French toast with pears - The first place I've gone to that uses fruit other than blueberries, bananas, or strawberries which is refreshing to see.

Service:  The staff is friendly and attentive.

Ambiance:  This has that cool neighborhood joint feel to it.

Overall:  Solid food...I know I'll be back here to try some other things.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Felt like an episode of Cheers. Plenty of locals coming in here and everyone knows each other by name, a rarity sometimes in this city. 

I had their brioche French toast with warmed up pears and walnuts. The date had his veggie hash with country potatoes and eggs. I loved their toast, had four pieces and cream on top and the veggie hash was mixed with red, green bell peppers with onions, mushrooms and spinach. Portions were fair and the guy behind the counter was funny. Great place to talk about sports while having breakfast.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Came here with the lady for breakfast!

She was hungry and needed some coffee so I figured why not go to BIG JOES!

Fortunately, we found parking just down the block. Also, when we walked in there was a booth available as well. This place was packed when we got here. I did not want to wait to be seated so it was all perfect timing. 

After taking a seat we waited for a bit to be served with menu. This place was very busy. The server was very nice. I ordered my Spanish Omelette with wheat toast. 

After placing the order we waited roughly 20 minutes or so for our food. This was somewhat expected considering how busy this place was and the number of servers, 2!!!

My understanding in observing this is that people are going to have to wait for some really GREAT FOOD. 

When the food finally came I was pleased. Everything looked exceptionally good. The taste test....WOW! Well worth the wait. Amazing food and the lady liked the coffee as well. 

Good meal. We did have breakfast so I do not know if the lunch food is just as good or better!

But, my FOOD was GREAT! If you have a free morning and want a nice place to go and sit down for breakfast then come here and get here earlier so that you can get a good spot to sit. 

Oh, the hospitality is really GOOD! 

#treatyourselftosomethinggood
author: Robert F.

description: I was very excited to try this place out, it's close to my house. I ordered a breakfast burrito and got one of the worst burritos ive ever had in my life. My burrito was 80% pico de gallo and like 20% combination of eggs, cheese, and sausage. Absolutely no flavor and kinda pricey. Will never be coming back.
author: Brian C.

description: My wife and I had breakfast together here, and it really was a delight! On the surface it just looked like another typical breakfast place, and the menu had all the basic fare you would expect from a breakfast diner - but there was just a little something special about the flavors that exceeded our expectations. Well done!
author: Seth S.

description:
I was able to sneak away from work for a day and spend a lovely morning with my partner on a Thursday! 

Naturally, I took to Yelp looking for assistance on where to go for brunch and this topped up on the list. The reviews were good, the photos looked good, so we decided to give it a try!

Street parking was very easy. Found 1 hour parking right in front. lots of spaces open near by as well. When you walk in you will notice it is a small place, but the tables aren't packed in too tightly at all. I loved the locals decor, nice touch!  

We were seated right away and offered menus. Drink orders were taken after a short time and they arrived with a smile and a request to make our food order. 

I ordered the Ham and Cheese burrito - which was HUGE, stuffed to the gills with eggs and meat. The salsa on the side was mild and perfect for my taste buds. The burrito came with a mixed green salad which was tossed in a light, tasty vinaigrette. 

My partner ordered the the Pesto, Spinach, Mushroom and Chicken omelette. It was PACKED with veggies and meat, but the favorite part was how the pesto was mixed in with the eggs itself, it was SUCH a lovely flavor. The omelette was accompanied by home fried potatoes.

Our male server, who may have also been the owner or manager was very friendly, chatty but not annoying, and very welcoming. 

If I was in the area, I would absolutely come here again!
author: Meghan L.

description:
This rating is for the quality of service or the lack there of.  If I could, I'd rate this place with negative stars!  It was a busy Saturday.  They had to start a list of customers on the back of their receipt booklet to make sure everyone was seated accordingly... Lots of yelling from the waitresses as to who is taking care of which table, who should be seated next, who took care of the togo orders, which table ordered what food as it was coming out of the kitchen. It was a VERY unorganized day for Big Joe's.  The manager on dutie wasn't much help with trying to get the place flowing as it should.  

Our food took FOREVER!  My husband had to go next door to the coffee shop to get a snack for our kids. We thought about leaving, but we walked to Big Joe's to have brunch and didn't want to have our kids wait again for food.  What's even more disturbing,  a customer came in as we were finishing up, seemed to be the managers friend, he was treated with better service than everyone else.  He wanted the door closed, and the staff made it happen.  Bad move cause it got stuffy quick.  Its a very small restuarant.  This customer waited maybe no longer than 10 minutes to get his food WTF!  We waited close to 45 minutes for ours.  To top it all off, he wanted his food cooked a certain way, and they made it happen.  I guess its really about who you know...

I probably can keep going, but I'll end here.   We definitely won't be going back to Big Joe's.  Oh wait the quality of the food, wasn't all that.  Don't waste your time and money.
author: Cheryl M.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend for brunch on a Friday afternoon around 11ish. The place was fairly empty and we were seated pretty fast. This place is smaller than it look in the pictures so it's not a good idea to come with a party of more than 4 people. 

Service:
There was only one waitress working, given that the place is pretty small. It was understandable but it did slow down the service. It took her awhile to take our orders and for our food to come but I didn't mind the wait since I wasn't too hungry. 

Food:
I got the Big Joe's burrito and he had the brioche french toast. I ended up eating more of the french toast than my burrito because it was that good! The cooked pear and walnuts gave the french toast a good texture and a sweet/nutty taste to it. The burrito was pretty good too and the sauce that came along with it was surprisingly spicy. 

Overall: 
I would come again if I'm around the area and is in the mood for sandwiches or the french toast again.
author: Annie V.

description: Came here for the first time today, and honestly it was a pretty underwhelming experience. Our meals were not super visually appealing. The meat lovers omelette was dry and fell apart as we were eating it. My English muffin was very burnt underneath my eggs Benedict so it was extremely tough to cut through. In addition to that, we didn't have any condimets on our table and they didn't have lemon when we requested it with our water. Overall however, it was a nice clean restaurant, the location was convenient for us, and the service was pretty good. Food was a bit off for us. I would give 2 stars based on food alone.
author: Vivian Z.

description: My boyfriend and I had the breakfast burritos. They were not the best, very whitewashed and lacked flavor. Very dissapointing considering the high reviews this place has. Staff was sassy which I enjoyed.
author: Ellie G.

description:
The great thing about SF is that there's always somewhere great to eat close by. We were craving some brunch so we found Big Joe's on Yelp which was open and close to where we were. Luckily was got there at a good time because shortly after we were seated there was a line of about 10 people waiting for a table. 

It's got the old diner feel to it. Simple but very delicious food. We ordered their eggs benedict and the tuna melt sandwich. Delicious! They're also known for the french toast, which I'll have to try the next time.
author: Cindy K.

description:
This was  my first visit to Big Joe's. We were looking for a new place or lunch after church and were not disappointed. The restaurant is very small with 6 stools at the counter and probably 20 seats at the remaining tables. We got there right before the rush and we watched the line begin to build. The staff was very friendly and gave great recommendations. I did notice one thing that could be an issue. While we were there they ran out of orange juice, french toast, and another menu item. This was weird as it was only 11:00 am. Besides that it is a great diner type restaurant with good food. I can highly recommend the fried chicken sandwich and the pancakes. Also, try to get a seat at the counter the staff is very friendly and you seem to get a little bit quicker service. Not a great place for a large group.

Overall we were very happy with our visit and will be back again soon.
author: John G.

description:
The Brioche French Toast is perfect! It is not too sweet or too plain. The nuts add a good, crunchy taste to the softness of the toast. 

FYI, the yelp deal still works! The nice waitress was reminding everyone to check-in for free coffee!
author: Xe X.

description:
WHO WOULD HAVE THOUGH BIG TASTY THINGS COME FROM SMALL EATERIES.

I like those places tucked away from the masses, they are called hidden gems. The place is super tiny, ran by very kind people with efficient service, and the food was pretty tasty. 

ARNOLD PALMER - typical. Wish the ratio of lemonade to tea was more. 

FRENCH TOAST - unbelievably good!!!Ordered 1/2 serving of the French toast as I heard and seen the full serving is fulfilling. Its paired with walnuts, marscapone, and caramelized pears. WOW. The pears took French toast to a new level. The thickness of the French toast was thick and not so dense, had a nice "fluff" to it. Highly recommend. Just take note, they can run out of it. 

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
First time trying and never coming back. 

We ordered the big Joe burrito for my boyfriend with no bacon because he's allergic to bacon. I ordered the veggie hash.

When we got the food, where was my veggies in my hash?? And worst of all, they put bacon in my boyfriends burrito...he's ALLERGIC!! DO YOU WANT TO KILL HIM?? I saw the waitress write down no bacon and the cook was too lazy to read and abide. 

Never coming back.
author: Michelle C.

description: Awesome small San Franciscan diner with a cozy, intimate vibe. Great food and portion sizes. Will be returning!
author: Isabel T.

description:
Closer to 3.5 stars.
After a night out, we were all desperately craving brunch food on an early Sun afternoon and we stumbled onto Big Joe's in the Outer Mission. It was around 1:30pm and the wait was 5 mins.The interior is old school diner, charming in its own right and cozy. They're not really setup to accommodate larger parties. From what I recall, I only remembered two tables that could seat 4, with the other tables being 2 tops.

I ordered the Big Joe's burrito(Turkey, bacon, scrambled eggs and seasonal veggies served with home potatoes or mixed greens) and I was  pleased with the texture and mix of flavors(not too salty and definitely hearty). 

Service was pleasant and friendly. Just a note about the free coffee with your Yelp check-in; Apparently, it only applies to one per table(even though it's not documented anywhere).
author: Dennis W.

description: Super friendly staff but the food isn't that good. I ordered the Spanish omelette, which came packed with green bell peppers. My partner ordered the grilled cheese sandwich. It was really, really bland. Then again, who orders a grilled cheese sandwich for breakfast? I say that's partly his fault. The pancakes were absolutely delicious. I had half an order. Not sure if a half order only includes half syrup since that's all I got with it. If I was to come back, this would be the one thing I'd order. When I told the waiter I did not like the omelette, he apologized and suggested I order something else next time if I'm not vegetarian. I'd like to eat what I want and taste good regardless of whether I'm vegetarian or not, but hey nice effort to ask and make the customers feel right at home.
author: Antonella H.

description: This restaurant completely exceeded my already high expectations with great service and delicious food. Being a dodger fan I figured I'd run into a little bit of grief considering the walls are clad with Giants memorabilia, and I was met with a few playful jabs but that did not tarnish the experience. There was a great and very hospitable vibe throughout the restaurant and the service was prompt. I will definitely return, with more Dodger gear & a bigger appetite!
author: Gaven B.

description:
Pros: Clean, Modern, good coffee

Cons: Prices, 

Not many restaurants are open for breakfast in the morning during the work week. Big Joes was and thus I entered to grab some breakfast with my mother. The place seems to bring in lot of regulars. It is a small but functional space.

I had the Joes breakfast burrito. Priced I believe at $10.00 which seems like lot considering the size. My mother had a breakfast sandwich which was something like 11.00.

Total for us included two coffees and rounded to about $26

The flavors on both our meals was good. The only complaint I really have is the portion size relative to the price.

Both seemed awfully small and considering the location being away from the big city. I would expect more portion size or cheaper prices.

The good itself again was really on point. The coffee and service were great. Overall a good spot just be prepared to open your wallet.
author: Nathan A.

description: Great breakfast. Great environment Friendly service. Would definitely go back again for their breakfast
author: Ruben R.

description:
I love this place ! The hospitality here is wonderful, truly felt like I was visiting my cousin's place for a holiday dinner and not just a great brunch joint. The servers were attentive, happy, and quick on their feet.

My crew and I needed someone filling for lunch so we ordered a turkey bacon sandwich, an omelette, and eggs benedict.... Our dishes definitely satisfied our cravings. Big Joe was taking our order and he said that his French Toasts are the best - he definitely stood by it so he gave us an order on the house to try since it was our first time there.
After taking a bite, I now understand why it was so FAMOUS! The toast is made out of brioche bread = super fluffy. The pears were still crunchy and sweet. Mascarpone dollop was 10/10. Ugh, party in your mouth. I swear. Please do your mouth a favor and order it !!!

It was my first time here, and I would love to come back again. Thanks Big Joe and his crew for the great services.
author: Quynh X.

description: Just ok. Potatoes seemed like they were out of the frozen section. Eggs Benedict was cooked well but bland. Won't bother coming back.
author: Mrs. S.

description:
I've been here before and the food has never been good, but the guy at the counter will try to hit on your girlfriend so be weary.

I hadn't been to this spot for years but I decided to take my girlfriend here for breakfast since she had to do work on her laptop and there was Wifi here. The guy at the counter started talking to us a lot (more specifically to my girlfriend) which is fine because we're friendly people, and the server just seemed like a friendly person. I left for a while to go take care of some stuff and came back a few hours later to pick her up. 

After we leave, the first thing she tells me is that the guy was hitting on her until she told him that I was her boyfriend, to which he replied that he had thought that I was her brother.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Great location.  Have been driving by for years & decided to give them a try. 

While I waited for my breakfast, there was a smell of someone smoking a cigarette. The unappetizing odor was coming from the back door. (Wonder how that could happen)

Food was great, only 1 slice of toast which seems cheap for the price of the breakfast.  

2 strikes against them. Unlikely to return. 

I was there over the summer. The chicken sausage was one to remember. I don't know of any other place that serves 1 slice of toast, so I wouldn't think to ask if breakfast comes with 2 slices of bread.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Nice friendly owner, talkative and attentive. Excellent fried potatoes and toast with apple sausage. Eggs a trifle runny, otherwise, excellent. Knows how to make good Earl Grey tea as well.  Agree with Mack A.'s review.
author: Jayeson V.

description: Pete is the man and the food and service at Big Joe's are always excellent. My favorite is the spinach and egg sandwich...and the coffee!
author: Anne F.

description: Picture was taken and posted immediately.  That was 5 days ago.  Pictures are worth a thousand words. I live 5 mins away n took photo right after pickup.  Food was horrible  as you can see in the photo. I wouldn't pay half the price and will never go back. The REAL ORIGINAL BIG JOES was the best. Corned Beef Hash Browns, Omelettes especially Big Joes Omelette n Burgers.  You guys don't even serve a BIG Joes Omelette nor even Serve Regular Hash Browns.. I'm a local that has lived in the area since Emmys was on the corner. That's over 30 years.  Very Disappointed.
author: Hungry K.

description: Friendly owner (with a bit of a NYC edge to him); clean counter. Good food. Local clientele. I'll be back.
author: Walter M.

description:
I went there for lunch with my family and when I'm ready to pay my credit card bill, there were 2 charges from Big Joes even though we only ate their one time. I never got a receipt from this place but the touch screen did gave me option to enter my email address to have the receipt sent to me via email. I entered my email and receipt was never received. This is the very first time I been to a restaurant where I got charged twice, I have filed a dispute with my credit card company on the 2nd charge.

Their food was okay but price is not cheap, $14 for a burger. The service is not good, it's very slow because one guy does everything and he was kind of a bully, he's probably the owner. If someone name their restaurant after their name with a Big word in front of it, it's pretty obvious right? I'm Big Joe, don't mess with me or else, you feel me? and he said "you gonna write a yelp for me right?", he was demanding customers to give him yelp review.
author: Chloe W.

description:
I want to love this place. I really do. The service is wonderful and the place has a great neighborhood vibe. It's also great to not have a long wait on a weekend morning. 

The food was poorly executed both times I've visited. The hollandaise on the Eggs Benedict was a very skimpy portion barely covering the eggs, and was essentially tasteless. The eggs were not fully poached, with some of the white raw inside. The French toast was mushy on the inside. The pancakes tasted like cardboard and were not improved by the weird strawberry butter.

They need a better, more experienced chef on weekend mornings. No wonder most of the place was empty. Those servers are doing a great job and deserve a competent, experienced crew in the kitchen to back them up.
author: InflatedSenseOfSelf U.

description: This is the spot to get a good quality breakfast. Me and my wife are visiting from Phoenix AZ and looked up breakfast places and big joes popped up and I'm glad it did. The pancakes and strawberry butter were excellent. The breakfast sandwich was delicious and fresh coffee. The vibes from this place were very welcoming and friendly, made me feel happy to interact with everyone at BIG JOES. Definitely will be coming back to BIG JOES next time I come to SF.
author: Sal S.

description: Haley is a babe . Would def recommend their Benedict. Def a Lowkey diner but good vibes here
author: Kimbro S.

description: It's the local neighborhood spot with great food. Feels cozy. Staff is nice. Don't expect to get in and out quick though.
author: Evan A.

description: The breakfast was AMAZING! Plus the cozy, family run, vibe just made me feel at home. I'm definitely coming again. Word to the wise, it's a small place so if you have a big group this may not work for you.
author: Aurora M.

description: I am pretty sure the guy who owns this place hates his job. He has his headphone on and looking down at his phone. Too busy on his phone so he won't even bother to giving you a welcome.
author: Kelly H.

description: Great breakfast friendly staff. Gotta try French toast next time. U huh... clean and fresh...lunch or breakfast a good "locals" haunt....will return!
author: Paul D.

description:
This is definitely a gem in the outer mission.

Came here on a random whim for breakfast with my friend. He was craving some good ol' french toast, and i wasn't quite sure what i really wanted. Upon entering, the place is a small little store with a few cube seats set aside the counter. The worker there was very inviting, and it seemed like other patrons of the store really enjoyed his company.

My friend ordered the Brioche French Toast, which basically is French Toast with brandied peaches, pecans, mascarpone cream, and berry sauce ($9.00). I wasn't sure what to order, but what really caught my eye was the buttermilk pancakes with STRAWBERRY BUTTER($8.00). I've never tried that and since I'm a sucker for strawberries i thought, why not. It also had a lemony compote and maple syrup.

The serving portions are pretty god here. I didn't get to try my friend's order but i liked mine. The pancakes were nice and fluffy, and the strawberry butter was quite unique. It was a spread with strawberry bits and it just tasted really good :-) and the lemony compote added a nice zing to it also. Only downside was that at one point my pancakes started getting dry but nothing that maple syrup can't fix.

They accept card here, whoohoo! Good breakfast for reasonable prices :-) You will leave this place happy.
author: Jerianne G.

description: This place was decent. The service was excellent. It's a very small restaurant with not very much seating, but the food is good. I enjoyed this place but when I went here yesterday I was bummed to find out their espresso machine wasn't working
author: Niña E.

description:
Cozy diners with farm fresh ingredients are a necessity for a city seeking to support their local producers. Big Joe's supplies all of this at a great price and friendly wait staff.

Location is right off of Monterey. I can imagine parking being a little tough, but strolling in a little after 1:30 on a Saturday, was able to to find a spot right in front. We were seated right away and ready for our meal. I decided to order the Egg Tart as per pictures making it look delicious.

With a casual debate over what the difference is between an egg tart and quiche (I concluded it was due to the size), I dug in for a bite. The tart was nice and flakey, while cooker thoroughly through. The one egg on the side was best placed on top of the potatoes to let it run through. I mean, that was the plan except my egg-lifting skills were obviously put into question that day. 

A definite follow up is needed to try some of their other great offerings on their menu. The egg tart was just an appetizer to the next time I come by and try out their breakfast menu again.
author: Eric L.

description: I love Big Joe's. The food and coffee is always fantastic. Oh, and the breakfast sandwich with avocado and bacon is SO GOOD. Besides the great food I come here for the wonderful hospitality. The guy that works here is friendly and always makes my boyfriend and I feel right at home. When it's busy the service is spread a little thin but I always leave happy. Just be aware this is a tiny spot and fills up quickly during peak weekend brunch hours.
author: Lisa C.

description: Eat at Joes! My wife and I are from the northeast. This place is so reminiscent of a hometown diner. The sort of special place your parents would take you when they let you take a "sick day" off school. Or where you and your friends would go after a heavy evening the night before. Food is delicious and unpretentious. We had french toast and the Spanish omelette, both were excellent. Owner and staff make you feel like family. Ample street parking. This place is the real deal and worth a trip.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Very nice small Coffee Shop.
Great for Breakfast
Located near Public Transit.
Many longtime customers.
author: Gary N.

description: My food was completely unacceptable, it tasted rancid. I didn't even eat it. The whole vibe of the place seemed very unprofessional. While our server was serving us he was yelling across the room to another table and having a completely separate conversation unrelated to food service. Frankly this place shouldn't be in business anymore.
author: P H.

description:
What can I say? This place is amazing. The owner's daughter/server was so kind and accommodating. She was genuinely friendly and a hard worker! Even though she had her hands full, she was all-smiles and treated her customers well. Even on her birthday when I'm sure most people would rather NOT be at work!

The food....ughhh the food was amazing and I'm only sad that we don't live in SF and we can't come back all the time. I had the Eggs Benedict with a side of pancakes and I loved it. My daughter had the MM pancakes and hubs had the Two Eggs special with fluffy pancakes. 

The pancakes came with a strawberry butter.. So unique and delicious. This is a very down-to-earth, home made, family memories type place. I LOVE IT and if we're ever back in town we are definitely going back!
author: Ronna B.

description:
Service rating- less than one star. 

....45 minutes after being seated in this quaint establishment- empty water, empty coffee going on 15 minutes...and two tables seated after us mid-way through their meals- I finally catch the server's attention. What was supposed to be an enjoyable new brunch experience turned into the gnarliest hangry experience I've had. Grrrr.

This place is too small to lose track of a table, and it's not okay to allow new patrons to leave hungry. And one of the two servers- pipe down!! I don't want to overhear that you woke up drunk.  

Why would we even return to redeem the raincheck for free meals after this bullshit experience?
author: Ann B.

description: Loved this place really good food and service. My husband had the eggs Benedict and I had the two eggs anyway you want and we shared the French toast. Everything was fresh and delicious. The potatoes where bomb! I definitely recommend this place.
author: Alejandra C.

description: the brioche french toast is 10/10. I honestly can't even explain how bomb. The atmosphere is so cozy. It's such a cute lil neighborhood spot! I almost don't want to leave this review bc I don't want it t get too poppin. But truly, they deserve it. The waitresses are so friendly, attentive and offer great suggestions if you've never been and they'll absolutely remember you if you have. Definitely a go to brunch spot.
author: Kalani R.

description:
Tip #1 - Check in on Yelp and get GOOD, free coffee. 

I live a few blocks away, closer to Bosworth but my lazy ass took the 23 to go a few blocks at 10 am in the morning lol. It wasn't that packed when I got in but I got a seat at the counter. I read a lot about the Spanish Omelete so I got that. Showed the waitress my Yelp check in and got the cawfee ova hereeee. I'm listening to my podcast and laughing while looking like an idiot and i turn around and the entire place is packed. I guess Glen Park doesn't wake up until 11 am. 

I had asked for the garlic potato wedges with my dish since they came with the lunch sandwiches, I didn't realize you also got potato in the omelette itself oooooh jeezuz. It comes with some sliced up peppers inside and a bit of spice on top with a side of toast or english muffin. I definitely want to try the pancakes and french toast next time, they looked really good. 

I'm also pretty sure i saw the Joe of Big Joe's and he looked like a former WWE/WCW guy, maybe Sting without the makeup, Stone Cold's cousin, who knows.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
It was my best friend's birthday and we wanted a good brunch, we are not locally from San Francisco so we took our chances and we were more than pleased. It is a small little spot but the atmosphere and people were AMAZING. Right from the beginning we were greeted with a warm hello and seated. The waitress were all so attentive and interactive, they constantly checked up on us and when they found out about our friend's birthday they brought out a pancake with a candle and began to sing happy birthday. It was an amazing place to hang out with friends. 
The food was amazing, good portion and best of all great price. I am so happy with my experience. I recommend it highly and will be going back for a visit soon.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Tiny place. Good food. Great service. Street parking. 

I don't know if I'd go out of my way to go back to this place, but if I was a local I'd be all up in it.
author: Bree M.

description:
So, didn't actually get to eat here as they weren't open at 7 like they said, but the guy using a leaf blower in front said we could wait outside for half an hour in the drizzle if we wanted to...?

And congrats are due to whomever was the fluffer on the profile photos for this place, because in person it honestly looked like a dive.
author: M C.

description: Easy going local breakfast place with good food. Their quiche and salad, offered only on weekends, is the best thing in the menu. Family friendly and good for kids.
author: Marcia d.

description: The best coffee, pancakes, and bacon. Joe the owner is awesome and makes everyone feel very welcome.
author: David B.

description:
It's the perfect hole in the wall breakfast stop. It was busy when we arrived but the wait time wasn't too bad. I was impressed by the 2 ladies running the ENTIRE operation (besides the cooking). During my short time waiting I observed them seat people, take their orders, bring out their food, bring their bill, take orders over the phone, give coffee refills, clean tables once empty, and pretty much everything in between. They were also very gracious while doing all of it. 

I ordered the chicken & pesto omelette with the mixed greens. The salad and omelette were both delicious! I was very satisfied. Two tables down I saw someone having a yogurt parfait that looked yummy so I ordered one to go. The seasonal fruit was fresh and served as the perfect dessert. 

Overall, I loved my experience! I will definitely be returning. I wouldn't suggest this place for someone who is claustrophobic or doesn't like eating in close proximity to others. But if you're looking for delicious food with great hospitality, Big Joe's is where it's at! :)
author: Yanet P.

description:
Great food.
Fast service.
Very good for breakfast.

We came on a Saturday mid-morning and there was only a five minute wait.

She had the French toast and so should you, its great.
author: Justin S.

description:
Great breakfast!  My son and his girlfriend recommended this restaurant for breakfast.  It is a small cafe in a multicultural neighborhood.  The owner is a friendly and outgoing man who in the process of making coffee, taking orders and serving food, also made time not only to talk to his patrons but to listen to their answers and seemed to take a genuine interest in them.

The food was fantastic!  I split the Brioche French Toast with my son in exchange for half of his Eggs Benedict.  All delicious, made the way it is supposed to be made!  My husband had the Spinach and Egg sandwich.  I took a bite of it, and it was also delicious!  

The coffee was hot and freshly brewed...what more can I say?  Give it a shot!
author: Robin A.

description: Good is good here. The pictures were self explanatory. The service was ok. Two waitress's doing a wonderful job in a very very tight space cafe. You have to ask for water- napkins, silverware and jelly (which they ran out of...) finally when we did get the water the glasses were dirty- seriously. I gave 3 stars because I like the restaurant. I've been here before prior to the new owners of 2 years or so great neighborhood. Choose wisely when to dine. Preferably when it's not that busy.
author: Nate C.

description: Excellent option for breakfast with local people in San Francisco. Food very well prepared and delicious. I really recommend Big Joe's!!!
author: Lucas B.

description: Great breakfast joint at your local Burlingame area. Nothing's greasy but yet still flavorful.  Good portions and friendly waitstaff.  Been coming here for years.
author: Ted Y.

description: The food wasn't bad but the customer service was horrible we got kick out right after we were done because there were 4 guys waiting, when there was an empty table next to us, you're not supposed to give your customers a time limit. They might have sold another meal but they certainly lost 4 costumers. We are never going back!!!
author: Mdox J.

description: Such a good find!  Food and staff were both awesome. Not a lot of seating but worth the wait. They don't take Amex so be prepared for that.
author: Melanie M.

description:
We stayed at a place near Big Joe's for 3 days while on vaca. We searched for a breakfast place and found this gem!
We had the steak sandwich and the spanish omelett as well as a half order of frech toast. The steak sandwich was way better and tastier than the one we had at the supposedly "best cheesesteak place" in Philly (Pat's King of Steaks - NOT!!!) 
The spanish omelett was tasty and filling and the half order just made it perfect!

Also the service was great, the coffee was very good and we can definitely recommend this place! 

Support your local breakfast place!!!
author: Kathrin H.

description: The food was amazing but the service could see some improvement. The waiting time for food was excessive and also the employees were conversing across the restaurant fairly loud to each other about personal things.
author: Eduardo P.

description: This diner is a hidden gem. The food is amazing and worth the slightly high prices. The staff is so friendly. They have very limited seating so I would imagine that it is hard to eat there on the weekend.
author: Lily W.

description: Strong (GOOD) coffee, delicious food, excellent service, neighborhood feel. There's nothing that isn't 5 stars about this adorable cafe. We walked in and felt like one of the locals. The breakfast burrito was delicious (served with a side salad, always a winner in my book). Those pancakes though...SO delicious you don't even need the syrup. Super clean dining room (restrooms, too). Our kids were kinda cranky because we made them wait for breakfast, but they were offered some coloring books and quickly turned it around. The prices are just right (our fam of five can get pricey when eating out, but we felt like everything was fairly priced here) and Joe knows about all there is to know about the area, so ask if you're looking for something to do. Seriously, will be back next time we are in town.
author: Ashley H.

description:
So good! Well worth the wait for the delicious meal that we had. 

I had the eggs Benedict and added avocado to it. So sad that I do not live in town to come here more. I would eat here everyday if I could!

Service is so great and when we were waiting they kept coffee refilled to keep us warm. Can't wait to come back!!!!
author: Elissa A.

description: Food was really good and we visited twice during our SF vacation. The owner was charismatic and attentive.
author: Lorrayne R.

description:
It's stones throw form my place. I couldn't be more happier with the food and the location! 

Tried their sandwich and I was satisfied. 

Just wish they opened for dinner too. Apparently their brunch wait times are crazy. I never had to wait as I mentioned it's stones throw from my place and I know when the place is less crowded 

The service was great as well. Would highly recommend
author: Milana R.

description: Ordered pancakes and they were burnt! Before the ones I ordered were good and these are burnt and taste dry and terrible
author: Dora A.

description:
First, let me say I have a biased opinion of this place as two people, very near and dear to my heart, just started working here. So...naturally I would want to give them high marks for friendliness and customer service....but I will let you folks judge that yourselves.

That being said, my review is based purely off the quality of the food and the condition of the place...

Big Joes is a typical San Francisco neighborhood spot. It's small with not much parking nearby...so obviously a locals joint. 

Though small...the layout of the place affords maximum use of room and feels larger than it should. It is also one of the cleanest places I've been...compared to everywhere in San Fran.

BTW, as an aside...one of the main factors I look for in determining how clean a place is...is through the condition of their bathrooms. If any restaurant can't maintain a reasonably clean restroom...which is visible to the public...how clean are the conditions of their kitchen where only staff sees? In my mind...clean toilets=probably clean kitchen, dirty toilets=food borne illness dirty kitchen.

Anyway, Big Joes has a clean restroom.

So...the food. Sitting at the bar next to the kitchen, I could see their chef cooking everything. The kitchen looked very clean...and all the food was prepared quickly and all looked delicious. And...one of the first things I noticed was their chef knew how to make an omelette! One of my biggest pet peeves are places that serve omelettes overdone...which causes the eggs to get rubbery and dry. You shouldn't rely on the ingredients to keep the omelette moist! Big Joes chef cooked the eggs to just before being completely done...added the filling...threw on the cheese...expertly folded the omelette and pulled it off the grill just ever so slightly underdone! 

Now for those of you who cook...you know that food after coming off the heat continues cooking from residual heat for awhile. In this case...when my omelette arrived...less than a minute after being removed from the grill...it was reaching a perfect doneness! The eggs were perfect...the sausage and bacon filling was wonderful...it tasted great! I was also served some home fries...which were creamy and soft but with crispy edges...and seasoned perfectly.

Anyway....give Big Joes a try!
author: Richard J.

description:
Big Joe's is truly a neighborhood gem and has become a breakfast/brunch staple for me and my best friend.

The tiny, but cozy, restaurant serves up breakfast/brunch favorites all while adding their own touch. Their eggs benedict are my favorite thing to order but I have heard good things about their fried chicken sandwich from my best friend. I've also had their breakfast sandwich and pancakes, which were both absolutely delicious and made with fresh ingredients. Some of their menu items are seasonal. They have great coffee too!

Service has always been quick and done with a smile. This is definitely the type of place where the owner remembers you (which I really appreciate). Wait times on the weekend during peak brunch hours can be long but I haven't had to wait more than 30-35 minutes. 

While Big Joe's is a little out of the way, if you find yourself in the Glen Park/Outer Mission area, don't hesitate to have a meal there.
author: Stephanie C.

description: this place has so much potential! they are sitting on a goldmine. but it's kind of being squandered and that's sad to see. it really just needs some work to make it an attractive place to go. take of the tacky window paint and 7up sign. those are way outdated. and maybe hire someone and stay open for dinner. if they do these things they'd get great business like the Japanese or Chinese places on the street!
author: Simone B.

description:
Yeesh.

We arrived before 11 a.m., which is a small miracle for me on a Sunday. We had to wait about 5-10 minutes for a table.  BJ's is teeny-tiny, with not a ton of space to wait. We ended up scoring two seats at the counter.  It's now c. 11:10 a.m. PDT.

Here's where things get ugly.  

A male server comes by and asks us if we want something to drink. We ask for two coffees and two waters. We never get the coffees or the waters. The horror. The headache. Ten minutes pass, and a different female server comes by. She asks us if we would like something to drink.  We ask for two coffees, two waters, and one orange juice (because we noticed it at another table, and it looked yummy). She gets confused and asks us if we want one orange juice or two. We clarify that we want one. This time, we get two coffees, one orange juice and no water. Our previous server notices that we never got our beverages and mentions that they were out of coffee at the time we ordered it, which is why we never received it. BJ's: you are a breakfast place, you cannot be out of coffee. 

It gets worse.  

It's now 11:20 a.m. PDT. We place our order. For me: Breakfast burrito with bacon. For him: Breakfast sandwich with chicken apple sausage. Two waters. We notice that the two couples (one with screaming child in tow, for bonus points) that have come in after us have now been seated. We still have no water. Ten minutes pass. Twenty minutes pass. Thirty minutes pass. We have not received our order. Forty minutes pass. And still no food. The couples sat after us have received their orders. One table has a breakfast burrito, pancakes and an omelet. The other table has eggs benedict and a Spanish omelet. In the meantime, the female server has knocked into my chair serving other tables about 152 times--without apology. 

It gets worse. 

My boyfriend is way less patient than I am, so he asks where our order is and notes that the two tables that came in long after we did have already been served. The male server tells us that the cooks were probably just getting the "easier" orders out of the way before tending to ours. Really? I think a breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwich are far easier orders to cook than eggs benedict or a Spanish omelet. I think what happened was that our server forgot to put our order in. We have now been waiting 50 minutes for breakfast. Not cool. Without alcohol: super not cool. The male server offered to take care of our coffees, which were already free because we checked in on Yelp, so he took care of our orange juice. When you wait 50 minutes for breakfast at a place with under ten tables total, a free orange juice is not going to cut it. You trippin, boo.  

It gets worse.

The kitchen slaps our order together. It looked like Ray Charles made my boyfriend's breakfast sandwich. My rush job burrito was similarly underwhelming. Nothing was seasoned or dressed appropriately. My side salad was deluged with dressing. My boyfriend asked for aioli--he received a ramekin that was about 1/4 full of aioli. 

Our female server was cleaning the table behind us, and she rammed the chair from the table into my boyfriend's seat. You probably shouldn't seat people at the counter if you're going to ram into their seats 152 times. It's just not cool--I think I have whiplash now.  

We asked for the check. Our female server, who has been completely oblivious to us the entire time save for smacking into my seat 152 times, brings us the check without taking care of the orange juice or coffee. Maybe she was on Lyrica. I have no idea. We asked the male server to adjust the check, which he did.  

The Silver Lining. 

Our male server was very apologetic and tried hard to make things right--I just don't think he had the authority to do so. Our female server?  She's on Lyrica, I think. And the orange juice was delicious.  

I'd like to think this baffling experience was an anomaly, judging from all of the fantastic reviews this place gets, but man alive, it was the worst dining out experience I've had in a long time. I don't think we'll be back. I don't think my back could take it. Pass.
author: Sunny S.

description: Very friendly neighborhood eatery for a relaxed hearty breakfast.  My friends from out of town enjoyed the delicious selection and options.  We got our order to go because they are heading out of town, but we did notice our side of potato was missing from our breakfast sandwich :( hence the four starts and not give.  Next time I will have to check my to go orders more carefully. But definitely a good place to chill and eat with lively conversation from the house staff.
author: Nilu S.

description: My favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco hands down! The pancakes are amazing and the Eggs Benedict with homemade lemon hollandaise not to mention homemade lemon and strawberry butter. Whether you're a local or just visiting Big Joes is a must
author: Don R.

description:
Update: It's been about 2-3 hours since I've eaten the food from Big Joe's and I'm sick to my stomach. Been nauseous since I've had the food. They were my first and only meal of the day and I find myself in need of home remedies now.. 


Overcharged me. Rude. Food was subpar. 

Ordered carry out over the phone and the woman who answered was extremely rude. I asked for carry out and she replied in a rude tone, "you mean take out?" Then she makes me wait 10 minutes to make my order of two things that should've costed around $22 with tax but totaled to being $27? 

When I arrived at Big Joe's no one greeted me as I stood there. Finally one of the women looked at me unamused and said take out? And immediately charged me $27.68? I asked for a receipt and she says they don't do that. My two orders of the Chicken Pesto Omelette ( that didn't come with toast?!) and Meat Lover's Omelette that only had ham should've been $20 without tax. Not sure how these two things ended up being almost $28? After handing me my already cold food despite her saying 20 minutes I was dismissed rudely. Had high hopes but I am extremely unsatisfied with my experience.
author: Shaylene L.

description:
Big Joe's, more like super big personality! Big Joe's is more than just a breakfast spot but is a place where you're treated like family. I've never seen such great hospitality from the moment I stepped foot in the door to when I paid the tab and left. Mr. Big (the main guy behind the counter) was really personable and he practically knew every single customer that walked in. I got to give it up to him, he truly and genuinely takes interest in the customers and their stories which is rarely seen now a days. 

The food was as great as the service. I got the eggs Benedict with cut potatoes on the side and it was spot on from what you would expect. The hollandaise sauce was thick and creamy and on point. My friend got the meat lovers breakfast burrito and he as well agreed that it a delicious way to start the day.

I highly recommend and I can't stop telling people about this lovely place. Will certainly come back in the near future.
author: Arik A.

description:
Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.Kids place, just awesome. Sometimes they are closed for random reasons and they open late (for kids) at 8 AM, but better than anything on West Portal. Just about everything is super yummy and kid friendly. But pretty small so show up at 8 AM sharp.
author: Ryan K.

description: Great service, tasteful food in just right amount served, super friendly personnel and a very comfortable atmosphere. Definitely coming back!!!
author: Morena S.

description: THIS IS MY SPOTTTTT. Really good food and really good service! I always get the yogurt parfait.
author: Sonny Z.

description:
My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to meet another couple for a weekend breakfast.
The service and food were great, the selection was very good.  Unassuming and not pretentious....just a great little place for a great breakfast on a weekend.
We'll be back!
author: Mark M.

description:
This place is pretty awesome. I never knew about so I wasn't sure what to expect. Big is the most friendliest, funniest, most humble guy and my food was great! I got the organic eggs with bacon and mixed greens. The bacon was huge and crunchy. Best breakfast I've had in a while. I'll definitely be back! Thanks Big ;)

Side note: He's a San Francisco native!
author: YUMM E.

description:
