description: Shhhhhh dont tell nobodoy! dont tell a soul. She dances on beer cans and shingles!
author: Miss A.

description: Unassuming little place with pretty darn good food, great find in the neighborhood!  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich which was fantastic!  My girlfriend ordered the Niman Ranch burger which she said was great.  Not only was the food good but the service couldn't have more friendly!
author: Jeff C.

description: What a great find...thanks to yelp. The food was amazing and the server was fun. Looking forward to going back and bringing some friends to try a new place. The spanish omelet was delicious. There were four of us and everyone couldn't say enough things about the food.
author: Michael T.

description: From the outside, it's a miracle anyone would enter this place. The decor is painfully sad, the place is tiny and the bathroom is like the one from The Goonies.  BUT, this is the best place for breakfast! The french toast is incredibly good. Amy is the best. The service is fast. Kids are liked there which is very cool. Breakfast for 4 under $20 is my kind of place.
author: Molly W.

description: Great diner food for both breakfast and lurch.  If you order a sandwich, the server will give you a three-part serving tray with filled pickled relish, onions, and mustard so you can dump as much of it as you like on your plate.  Great omelettes and burgers!
author: Rick E.

description:
Oh wow ..... this place is absolutely awesome. It's a small litle place, but very clean and comfortable. The waitress Amy, is super friendly and pretty cool to talk to. I always feel welcomed by her and she makes the eating experience great.

Their breakfast food is okay...but what really makes this restaurant rock is their burgers. Seriously, their hamburgers are so tasty and juicy. I always end up ordering two, because they are that good! Their filet of sole is also fantastic. The quality of the food is always consistent and the prices are reasonable.

Try their lunch menu... Big Joe's won't disappoint. .
author: Ace C.

description: This place looks like a greasy spoon from the outside but the inside is actually spotless.  The burgers are great and they serve up some screamin' breakfasts for those hungover mornings i don't feel like cooking. The prices are very cheap too.  The little Chinese lady will remember your favorite order and she's very sweet.
author: anne m.

description:
i live one block away from this place and i walk to safeway almost every other day and always pass this place and never thought of going in there b/c it seemed so uninviting.  the place is nothing to look at...it's down right hole in the wall but heard very good reviews from friends and from yelp so i decided to go in yesterday to try their hamburger.

when i went in, there were only two customers.  as i sat down to order my hamburger to go, the customers were very friendly and engaged in conversations.  very friendly place, like everybody knows everybody in there.  it's a place where u feel right at home.  after i got my order, i tried to pay with my credit card but they didn't except credit card and she told me just pay it next time.  that was so nice of her just to suggest that.  i always carry cash so i paid her and thank her and went home to try the burger.

i had cheeseburger with french fries.  the burger was awesome.  the lettuce and tomatoes were fresh and crisp. obviously, she knows how to cook a burger...the meat was juicy.  the french fries was good also.  for the price of $6.50...i don't think u can beat that price anywhere.  of course i had better hamburgers from gourmet burger places, but if u want no frill and just regular burgers, this place is the place to come.  

i hardly give 5 stars but i think this place deserve it.  friendly owner, friendly customers, very good price and good burger....don't let the hole in the wall atmosphere discourage u from trying this place.
author: donald c.

description: I love mom & pop eateries. This is a mom & pop sort of place. The waitress is friendly, the food is decent, and the place is clean. The hours could use updating. Although...they're now open after 3pm for dinner. I think the waitress told me they come back at 5pm. I had a hamburger with mushrooms and onions with fries. My BF had the same. The tab came to around $22 with tip. We didn't order a drink. That seems a bit high for two burgers with onions, mushrooms, and frozen fries from a bag versus fresh.
author: Christian D.

description: I Like to eat at lil Mom & Pop joints.  If you are in Glen Park or near Monterey  Blvd. and you want some good, cheap diner food before 3:00pm,  Big Joe's is pure NICENESS. The lady who owns it is super kind. She's one of those people who is so nice you think she's being a smart a$$, until you see her treat everyone that way and you're like this fu@k!n RULES. Now I'm not saying she'll try to be yer best  friend, but she is very polite and attentive. It feels good when I drop my dollas at a joint where they appreciate it. This is one of those places. The menu is standard diner food with some daily specials. It's always tasty and served right. I prefer their burgers. They let you garnish them however you like which for me is a nice touch. All the onion and pickles I want ensures a fatty tip for the Lady who runs a great spot in an outta the way part of the city.
author: santiago g.

description: I was jonesing for tasty burger today and decided to stop by this local joint.  It was first visit to this establishment.  I walked into the restaurant at ~ 11:15am and has others have noted it is a cozy atmosphere.  The service was fast and very friendly and the burger was HUGE and pretty darn good - the fries were fresh and pretty darn good to.
author: Michael M.
